description: Skillbook for Event-Forge project - patterns, learnings, and best practices

skills.title: Setting up Changesets for monorepo package publishing
skills.problem: Need automated version management and publishing for multiple NPM packages in a monorepo
skills.solution: Use Changesets with linked configuration to synchronize versions across all packages

steps: Run 'pnpm changeset init' to create .changeset directory
Configure .changeset/config.json with 'linked' array containing package patterns
Add scripts: changeset, version-packages, ci:publish, release

skills.title: Using PyPI Trusted Publishers for secure publishing
skills.problem: Need secure PyPI publishing without manual API tokens
skills.solution: Use PyPI Trusted Publishers with GitHub Actions OIDC

steps: Configure PyPI project with Trusted Publisher settings (owner, repo, workflow, environment)
Set permissions: id-token: write, contents: read
Enable attestations: true for PEP 740 compliance

benefits: No manual API tokens to manage

skills.title: Synchronizing NPM and Python package versions
skills.problem: Monorepo with both NPM and Python packages needs synchronized versions
skills.solution: Create sync script that updates Python pyproject.toml from NPM package.json

implementation.approach: Read version from packages/core/package.json, update pyproject.toml using regex replacement
implementation.integration: Run as GitHub Actions step before publishing Python package

benefits: Single source of truth for versions (NPM core package)
Automated - no manual version updates needed
Runs in CI pipeline before publishing

skills.title: Implementing Changesets with GitHub Actions
skills.problem: Need automated workflow to create version PRs and publish packages
skills.solution: Use changesets/action@v1 in GitHub Actions workflow

workflow_structure.job_outputs: published, publishedPackages for conditional downstream jobs
steps: Run changesets action with publish command

workflow: Workflow creates 'Version Packages' PR (if changesets exist)
Merging version PR triggers publish job
Published packages trigger downstream jobs (e.g., Python publishing)

skills.title: Conditional PyPI publishing based on NPM release
skills.problem: Python package should only publish when NPM packages are published
skills.solution: Use job outputs and conditional execution in GitHub Actions

implementation.job_outputs: Set outputs in NPM job from changesets action
implementation.conditional_job: PyPI job depends on NPM job and checks published output

skills.title: TypeORM pessimistic locks must be wrapped in transactions
symptoms: Error: 'An optimistic lock can only be used inside a transaction'
Method using pessimistic_write lock fails at runtime
Query builder with FOR UPDATE SKIP LOCKED throws error
skills.root_cause: TypeORM requires pessimistic locks (FOR UPDATE) to be executed within an active transaction context
investigation: Check if query builder uses setLock('pessimistic_write') or setLock('pessimistic_read')
Verify if the operation is wrapped in dataSource.transaction()
Examine if operations use this.repository vs manager.getRepository()

solution.pattern: Wrap entire method in dataSource.transaction() and use manager.getRepository()
solution.after: async fetchAndLock() { return this.dataSource.transaction(async (manager) => { const query = manager.getRepository(Entity).createQueryBuilder().setLock('pessimistic_write'); }); }
key_changes: All operations in method must use manager.getRepository()

prevention: Always use pessimistic locks within transaction boundaries
Code review checklist: setLock() calls must be inside transaction()
Add integration tests for concurrent lock scenarios
Document transaction requirements in method comments
related_patterns: SKIP LOCKED for non-blocking concurrent processing
Atomic status updates within same transaction as lock

patterns.name: Monorepo multi-platform publishing architecture
patterns.context: Publishing packages to multiple registries (NPM + PyPI) from single monorepo
patterns.pattern: Use Changesets for NPM version management, sync script for Python versions, GitHub Actions for automation
components: Changesets - NPM version management and changelog
Version sync script - Synchronize NPM to Python
GitHub Actions workflows - Automation (release.yml for publishing, ci.yml for validation)
Trusted Publishers - Secure PyPI publishing without tokens

pros: Single source of truth for versions
cons: Requires external setup (NPM token, PyPI trusted publisher config)

patterns.when_to_avoid: Single package projects or infrequent manual releases

anti_patterns.name: Manual version updates in monorepos
anti_patterns.problem: Manually updating version numbers in multiple package.json files
why_bad: Inter-package dependency versions can get out of sync
anti_patterns.better_approach: Use Changesets with linked configuration for automatic version management

anti_patterns.name: Using PyPI API tokens in GitHub Actions
anti_patterns.problem: Storing PyPI API tokens as GitHub secrets
anti_patterns.better_approach: Use PyPI Trusted Publishers with GitHub Actions OIDC

anti_patterns.name: Using pessimistic locks outside transactions in TypeORM
anti_patterns.problem: Calling setLock('pessimistic_write') on query builder without wrapping in transaction
why_bad: Can lead to race conditions if not properly handled
Tests may pass but production fails
anti_patterns.better_approach: Always wrap pessimistic lock operations in dataSource.transaction()
